The Man who cheated death seven times, then won the Lottery Frane Selak, a now 85 year old retired music teacher from Croatia, after cheating death seven times, won £600,000 in the lotto in 2005.  His first brush with death was while traveling from Sarajevo to Dubrovnik in 1962 on a train. the train jumped the tracks and ended up in the river, which at the time was icy cold. despite the situation, Selak suffered only a broken arm, and managed to swim to shore, But this was much better than what happened to the seventeen people who drowned in that incident. In 1963, Selak took his first and only plane trip; no doubt not being a fan of trains at this point. During the flight, a door in the plane burst open. Selak was thrown from the aircraft and found himself skydiving without a parachute. Miraculously, he landed safely on a large haystack, though was unconscious when emergency personnel found him. He woke up in a hospital with only minor injuries. Other passengers were not so lucky. The open door caused the plane to crash, killing the other 19 aboard. Three years later, a bus he was on went over an embankment into a river, drowning four. Being no stranger to this sort of sudden plunge into a river while on some form of mass-transportation, once again, Selak was able to swim to safety, this time suffering only cuts and bruises. having nearly died aboard a train, a plane, and a bus, Selak decided it would be a good idea to drive around in his car. Unfortunately, his car caught fire as he was driving. He jumped out and ran away from the car, getting away just shortly before the car was engulfed in flames, followed by the gas tank exploding. He got a different car and Fire once again three years later, when a defective fuel pump sprayed gasoline over the hot engine. The resulting flames that suddenly shot through the air vents burned off most of Selak’s hair and caused him a couple other burns, but that was the extent of his injuries. It was over twenty years before his next near-death experience happened. No doubt deciding walking was the best way to safely get around, Selak was doing just that in Zagreb when he was hit by a bus. He was knocked down and only walked away with minor injuries. in 1996, Selak must have considered himself invincible, so he thought it would be safe to take a drive through the Mountains! This is just a near death experience waiting to happen. And, indeed, that’s what occurred. He came around a corner, only to see a large truck coming straight for him. With nowhere else to go to avoid a head-on collision, he crashed through a barrier to a 300 foot cliff. (Technically, I think this should count as two near death experiences, but that’s just me.) In 2005, Of course, he won- a jackpot of £600,000 (nearly $1 million). Having been married four times before, he decided to try for lucky number 5, proposing to his girlfriend. She accepted. Damn Lucky!! Man!!  Source : Frane Selak - Wikipedia Image Source : Frane Selak - Google Search

Short story I mistakenly thought epiglottis as some kind of tooth which lies deep down the throat and freaked myself out. Long story Just a few days ago, I had a little pain in my throat. So, out of curiosity I don't know why I shed battery light into my throat and saw this mysterious kind of thing which looked like this.  I immediately got alarmed and chills ran down my spine cause never in my life I saw like this and I thought it's some kind of tooth which got developed into my throat! I was like “what the hell is that in my throat?!” I rushed to my father to check if he also had same thing in his throat but unfortunately I didn't find anything like this. So, I got more worried. I thought it might be possible that I didn't able to see that “thing” for some reason. So, I checked my wife's throat as well. But as you may guess, I was not able to find such thing in her throat. After checking two of the person, I was in an impression that I got fucked up now and I will have to remove that “thing” by an operation. My parents also got worried and asked me to see the doctor for the same. I went to see our family doctor still in fear and told him everything I noticed. Then the doctor had shed light into my mouth and inspected it thoroughly and told me that it isn't worrying thing at all. It's called epiglottis which lies in every human being. It's a flap of cartilage at the root of the tongue, which is depressed during swallowing to cover the opening of the windpipe.  He also told me that it can be visible really easily like in mine but in many cases it's not. So, that's nothing to worry about. And the pain I have in my throat was only because of cold and acidity. He prescribed me medicines for the same and I left the clinic with sign of relief. And that's according to me was the biggest and surprising(and somewhat silly) mindblow I've ever faced in real life.
